intro: Spyridium mucronatum subsp. mucronatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
